clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: This drug is indicated to treat relapsing forms of Multiple Sclerosis MS in adults which includes clinically isolated syndrome relapsing remitting disease as well as active secondary progressive disease L12081

contraindications.disease: LD50 information for beta interferon is not readily available in the literature Overdose information Following an overdose with a very high dose of beta interferon one patient described in a case report experienced a modest rise in body temperature with diffuse limb and truncal erythema The symptoms resolved within 24 hours Biochemical and hematologic parameters were nonremarkable after the overdose A191871 In the case of an overdose discontinue beta interferon and resume when the patient has returned to baseline function
contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Interferon beta has antiviral and immunomodulatory effects It reduces demyelination the main component of Multiple Sclerosis pathophysiology reducing the clinical frequency of MS attacks and slowing disease progression A191751 A191784 L12096 In vitro studies have shown that beta interferon reduces the replication of certain coronaviruses in lung tissue A191874 Retrospective studies using combinations of mycophenolate mofetil and beta interferon showed improved survival against MERS CoV the virus that causes Middle Eastern Respiratory Syndrome MERS A191871

incompatibilities.description: The risk or severity of adverse effects can be increased when Human interferon beta is combined with Zidovudine
